verses.kjv: And it came to pass, after the year was expired, at the time when kings go forth to battle, that David sent Joab, and his servants with him, and all Israel; and they destroyed the children of Ammon, and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried still at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: In the spring, when kings typically go out to war, David sent Joab along with his officers and the entire army of Israel. They defeated the Ammonites and laid siege to Rabbah. But David stayed behind in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in an eveningtide, that David arose from off his bed, and walked upon the roof of the king’s house: and from the roof he saw a woman washing herself; and the woman was very beautiful to look upon.
verses.ct: One evening, David got up from his bed and went for a walk on the roof of the palace. From the roof, he noticed a woman bathing, and she was extremely beautiful.

verses.kjv: And David sent and enquired after the woman. And one said, Is not this Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite?
verses.ct: David sent someone to find out who she was. The report came back: "That is Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam and the wife of Uriah the Hittite."

verses.kjv: And David sent messengers, and took her; and she came in unto him, and he lay with her; for she was purified from her uncleanness: and she returned unto her house.
verses.ct: So David sent messengers to bring her to him. She came to him, and he had relations with her. (She had just completed her purification after her monthly period.) Then she went back home.

verses.kjv: And the woman conceived, and sent and told David, and said, I am with child.
verses.ct: The woman became pregnant and sent word to David, saying, "I am pregnant."

verses.kjv: And David sent to Joab, saying, Send me Uriah the Hittite. And Joab sent Uriah to David.
verses.ct: David then sent a message to Joab: "Send Uriah the Hittite to me." So Joab sent Uriah to David.

verses.kjv: And when Uriah was come unto him, David demanded of him how Joab did, and how the people did, and how the war prospered.
verses.ct: When Uriah arrived, David asked him how Joab was doing, how the troops were holding up, and how the war was going.

verses.kjv: And David said to Uriah, Go down to thy house, and wash thy feet. And Uriah departed out of the king’s house, and there followed him a mess of meat from the king.
verses.ct: Then David told Uriah, "Go home and relax." Uriah left the palace, and the king sent a gift of food after him.

verses.kjv: But Uriah slept at the door of the king’s house with all the servants of his lord, and went not down to his house.
verses.ct: But Uriah slept at the entrance of the palace with all his master's servants and did not go home.

verses.kjv: And when they had told David, saying, Uriah went not down unto his house, David said unto Uriah, Camest thou not from thy journey? why then didst thou not go down unto thine house?
verses.ct: When David was told, "Uriah didn't go home," he asked Uriah, "Haven't you just come from a long journey? Why didn't you go home?"

verses.kjv: And Uriah said unto David, The ark, and Israel, and Judah, abide in tents; and my lord Joab, and the servants of my lord, are encamped in the open fields; shall I then go into mine house, to eat and to drink, and to lie with my wife? as thou livest, and as thy soul liveth, I will not do this thing.
verses.ct: Uriah replied to David, "The ark, and Israel, and Judah are staying in tents. My commander Joab and your soldiers are camped out in the open fields. How could I go home to eat and drink and have relations with my wife? As surely as you live, I swear I will not do such a thing."

verses.kjv: And David said to Uriah, Tarry here to day also, and to morrow I will let thee depart. So Uriah abode in Jerusalem that day, and the morrow.
verses.ct: David said to Uriah, "Stay here one more day, and tomorrow I'll send you back." So Uriah remained in Jerusalem that day and the next.

verses.kjv: And when David had called him, he did eat and drink before him; and he made him drunk: and at even he went out to lie on his bed with the servants of his lord, but went not down to his house.
verses.ct: David invited him to eat and drink with him, and got him drunk. But that evening Uriah went out and slept on his mat among his master's servants. He still did not go home.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the morning, that David wrote a letter to Joab, and sent it by the hand of Uriah.
verses.ct: The next morning, David wrote a letter to Joab and sent it with Uriah himself.

verses.kjv: And he wrote in the letter, saying, Set ye Uriah in the forefront of the hottest battle, and retire ye from him, that he may be smitten, and die.
verses.ct: In the letter he wrote, "Place Uriah at the front lines where the fighting is fiercest, then pull back from him so that he gets struck down and killed."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Joab observed the city, that he assigned Uriah unto a place where he knew that valiant men were.
verses.ct: So while Joab was studying the city's defenses, he stationed Uriah at a spot where he knew the strongest enemy fighters would be.

verses.kjv: And the men of the city went out, and fought with Joab: and there fell some of the people of the servants of David; and Uriah the Hittite died also.
verses.ct: The men of the city came out and fought against Joab. Some of David's soldiers fell in battle, and Uriah the Hittite was killed as well.

verses.kjv: Then Joab sent and told David all the things concerning the war;
verses.ct: Joab then sent a messenger to report to David everything that had happened in the battle.

verses.kjv: And charged the messenger, saying, When thou hast made an end of telling the matters of the war unto the king,
verses.ct: He instructed the messenger, "When you've finished giving the king the full report about the battle,

verses.kjv: And if so be that the king’s wrath arise, and he say unto thee, Wherefore approached ye so nigh unto the city when ye did fight? knew ye not that they would shoot from the wall?
verses.ct: if the king gets angry and asks you, 'Why did you get so close to the city during the fight? Didn't you realize they would shoot down from the wall?

verses.kjv: Who smote Abimelech the son of Jerubbesheth? did not a woman cast a piece of a millstone upon him from the wall, that he died in Thebez? why went ye nigh the wall? then say thou, Thy servant Uriah the Hittite is dead also.
verses.ct: Who killed Abimelech son of Jerubbesheth? Wasn't it a woman who dropped a millstone on him from the wall, and he died at Thebez? Why did you go so near the wall?' — then tell him, 'Your soldier Uriah the Hittite is dead too.'"

verses.kjv: So the messenger went, and came and shewed David all that Joab had sent him for.
verses.ct: The messenger went and arrived and reported to David everything Joab had sent him to say.

verses.kjv: And the messenger said unto David, Surely the men prevailed against us, and came out unto us into the field, and we were upon them even unto the entering of the gate.
verses.ct: The messenger told David, "The enemy forces overpowered us and charged out against us in the open field, but we drove them back all the way to the city gate.

verses.kjv: And the shooters shot from off the wall upon thy servants; and some of the king’s servants be dead, and thy servant Uriah the Hittite is dead also.
verses.ct: Then archers on the wall shot down at your soldiers. Some of the king's men were killed, and your soldier Uriah the Hittite is dead as well."

verses.kjv: Then David said unto the messenger, Thus shalt thou say unto Joab, Let not this thing displease thee, for the sword devoureth one as well as another: make thy battle more strong against the city, and overthrow it: and encourage thou him.
verses.ct: David told the messenger, "Say this to Joab: 'Don't let this upset you — the sword kills one person just as easily as another. Press your attack against the city harder and destroy it.' Encourage him."

verses.kjv: And when the wife of Uriah heard that Uriah her husband was dead, she mourned for her husband.
verses.ct: When Uriah's wife learned that her husband was dead, she mourned for him.

verses.kjv: And when the mourning was past, David sent and fetched her to his house, and she became his wife, and bare him a son. But the thing that David had done displeased the LORD.
verses.ct: After the time of mourning was over, David had her brought to his house. She became his wife and gave birth to a son. But what David had done was evil in the LORD's sight.
